description: Smallest prime p such that p/pi(p)>=n.
example: pi(37)=12 and a(3)=37 is the smallest prime >= 3*12.
mathematica: Prime[Join[{k = 1}, Table[While[Prime[k]/k < n, k++]; k, {n, 2, 18}]]] (* _Jayanta Basu_, Jul 10 2013 *)
author: _Jud McCranie_
extensions: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jun 30 2008 at the suggestion of R. J. Mathar.
